verses.verse: Moreover <WH3254> Job <WH347> continued <WH5375> his parable, <WH4912> and said, <WH559>
Oh that <WH4310> I were <WH5414> as in months <WH3391> past, <WH6924> as in the days <WH3117> when God <WH433> preserved <WH8104> me;
When his candle <WH5216> shined <WH1984> upon <WH5921> my head, <WH7218> and when by his light <WH216> I walked <WH1980> through darkness; <WH2822>
As <WH834> I was <WH1961> in the days <WH3117> of my youth, <WH2779> when the secret <WH5475> of God <WH433> was upon <WH5921> my tabernacle; <WH168>
When the Almighty <WH7706> was yet <WH5750> with <WH5978> me, when my children <WH5288> were about <WH5439> me;
When I washed <WH7364> my steps <WH1978> with butter, <WH2529> and the rock <WH6697> poured me out <WH6694> <WH5978> rivers <WH6388> of oil; <WH8081>
When I went out <WH3318> to the gate <WH8179> through <WH5921> the city, <WH7176> when I prepared <WH3559> my seat <WH4186> in the street! <WH7339>
The young men <WH5288> saw <WH7200> me, and hid themselves: <WH2244> and the aged <WH3453> arose, <WH6965> and stood up. <WH5975>
The princes <WH8269> refrained <WH6113> talking, <WH4405> and laid <WH7760> their hand <WH3709> on their mouth. <WH6310>
The nobles <WH5057> held <WH2244> their peace, <WH6963> and their tongue <WH3956> cleaved <WH1692> to the roof of their mouth. <WH2441>
When <WH3588> the ear <WH241> heard <WH8085> me, then it blessed <WH833> me; and when the eye <WH5869> saw <WH7200> me, it gave witness <WH5749> to me:
Because <WH3588> I delivered <WH4422> the poor <WH6041> that cried, <WH7768> and the fatherless, <WH3490> and him that had none <WH3808> to help <WH5826> him.
The blessing <WH1293> of him that was ready to perish <WH6> came <WH935> upon <WH5921> me: and I caused the widow's <WH490> heart <WH3820> to sing for joy. <WH7442>
I put on <WH3847> righteousness, <WH6664> and it clothed <WH3847> me: my judgment <WH4941> was as a robe <WH4598> and a diadem. <WH6797>
I was <WH1961> eyes <WH5869> to the blind, <WH5787> and feet <WH7272> was I <WH589> to the lame. <WH6455>
I <WH595> was a father <WH1> to the poor: <WH34> and the cause <WH7379> which I knew <WH3045> not <WH3808> I searched out. <WH2713>
And I broke <WH7665> the jaws <WH4973> of the wicked, <WH5767> and plucked <WH7993> the spoil <WH2964> out of his teeth. <WH4480> <WH8127>
Then I said, <WH559> I shall die <WH1478> in <WH5973> my nest, <WH7064> and I shall multiply <WH7235> my days <WH3117> as the sand. <WH2344>
My root <WH8328> was spread out <WH6605> by <WH413> the waters, <WH4325> and the dew <WH2919> lay all night <WH3885> upon my branch. <WH7105>
My glory <WH3519> was fresh <WH2319> in <WH5978> me, and my bow <WH7198> was renewed <WH2498> in my hand. <WH3027>
Unto me men gave ear, <WH8085> and waited, <WH3176> and kept silence <WH1826> at <WH3926> my counsel. <WH6098>
After <WH310> my words <WH1697> they spoke not again <WH8138> <WH3808> and my speech <WH4405> dropped <WH5197> upon <WH5921> them.
And they waited <WH3176> for me as for the rain; <WH4306> and they opened <WH6473> their mouth <WH6310> wide as for the latter rain. <WH4456>
If I laughed <WH7832> on <WH413> them, they believed <WH539> it not; <WH3808> and the light <WH216> of my countenance <WH6440> they cast not down. <WH5307> <WH3808>
I chose out <WH977> their way, <WH1870> and sat <WH3427> chief, <WH7218> and dwelt <WH7931> as a king <WH4428> in the army, <WH1416> as <WH834> one that comforteth <WH5162> the mourners. <WH57>
